content: Chinese pastry **Red peach cake** ([Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 紅桃粿; [Pe̍h-ōe-jī](/wiki/Pe%CC%8Dh-%C5%8De-j%C4%AB): *âng-thô-kóe*), also known as **rice peach cake** ([Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 飯桃粿; [Pe̍h-ōe-jī](/wiki/Pe%CC%8Dh-%C5%8De-j%C4%AB): *pn̄g-thô-kóe*) and **rice cake** ([Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 飯粿; [Pe̍h-ōe-jī](/wiki/Pe%CC%8Dh-%C5%8De-j%C4%AB): *pn̄g-kóe*) is a small teardrop shaped [Teochew](/wiki/Teochew_cuisine) [kuih](/wiki/Kuih) (stuffed dumpling) with soft sticky [glutinous rice](/wiki/Glutinous_rice) [flour](/wiki/Flour) skin wrapped over a filling of glutinous rice, peanuts, mushrooms, and shallots. The skin of the *kuih* is often dyed pink, and shaped with a wooden mould before steaming. The cake is native to the [Teochew people](/wiki/Teochew_people).
title: Red peach cake
